key_channel_insights.line_content: High consistency with up to 97% matched fares for IE routes, though long-haul has seen occasional spikes in higher pricing.
Dominant MSE-lower exceeds 75% in most segments, with negligible overpricing under 1%.
Nearly 98% of prices are above direct rates, creating a consistent premium across markets.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: SAME fares dominate the OTA channel at roughly 88–90% overall, indicating strong alignment with airline site pricing.
OTA HIGHER jumped from 16% to 32% in the last week for long-haul, suggesting short-term pricing swings.
IE departures show near-complete fare parity at about 97% SAME, with minimal OTA-underpricing or missing offers.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Overall, these missing fares remain rare, with less than 1% across short-haul and under 2% on long-haul routes.
Consistently above 80% across all segments, peaking near 97% for IE itineraries—a strong display of matched pricing.
Remains minimal below 1% for most markets, reflecting little undercutting on the OTA channel.
A moderate share of roughly 9–16% on short-haul, with notable surges on long-haul reaching 32% in the previous week.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Maintains about 90% SAME fares weekly. OTA HIGHER trends around 9%, while OTA LOWER stays near 1% or less.
OTA HIGHER oscillates sharply, rising from 16% last week to 32% in the prior week, while SAME hovers between 66% and 85%.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Show over 96% SAME fares, with OTA HIGHER below 3% on a weekly basis and virtually no missing offers.
SAME remains around 82–86%, but OTA HIGHER is more notable at approximately 16% or higher.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Holds around 90% SAME fares, with OTA HIGHER near 8%. OTA LOWER is below 1% but stable.
SAME stands near 86–90% weekly. OTA HIGHER varies between 10% and 19%, while missing fares do not occur.

mse_highlights.line_content: Over 75% of fares surfacing as cheaper on the channel, reflecting a strong price advantage.
MSE-Higher remains consistently below 1%, posing negligible risk from above-market fares.
Same fares hover around 20%, with minor fluctuations week to week.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only sporadic cases where website offers did not appear on the channel.
Pricing parity stands at roughly 16–25% of itineraries, showing moderate alignment.
Dominates up to 90% in certain segments, underscoring wide channel discounts.
Remains under 1% overall, with minimal impact on competitive positioning.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: MSE-Lower runs 74–84% while SAME dips to about 16% in the latest week.
MSE-Lower surpasses 73%; SAME climbs as high as 26% over recent periods.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: MSE-Lower averages around 75%; SAME reaches toward 27% in intermittent intervals.
MSE-Lower rises to nearly 90%, reflecting stronger cross-market advantages.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: MSE-Lower runs about 78–85%, indicating robust near-term undercutting.
MSE-Lower registers around 69–77%, still dominant but slightly less than close-in rates.

gds_highlights.line_content: Across all dimensions, nearly 98% of GDS fares exceed the direct website price, reinforcing a consistent mark-up in this channel.
GDS-lower outcomes stay below 0.1%, indicating minimal undercutting of direct fares.
Ireland-origin routes reflect a higher average price premium of 2.78%, exceeding the Non-IE premium at 0.35%.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Roughly 1.6% of offers are missing in GDS, with minor fluctuations from week to week and a slight dip versus last month.
Effectively zero alignment between channels at under 0.1%, marking no significant parity with website options.
Predominant at nearly 98% in the latest week, with a steady 1.4% average price difference compared to the airline’s site.
Negligible presence below 0.1% over all periods, barely influencing overall channel competitiveness.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Nearly 99% of fares exceed website levels, carrying a 1.55% premium, with minimal instances of lower prices.
Mostly higher at 90%, but the premium is smaller at around 0.18%, indicating less mark-up on these routes.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 98.94% of fares are GDS-higher, averaging a 2.78% premium compared to the airline site.
97.86% of routes show GDS-higher with a modest 0.35% premium, plus a small 0.13% chance of price undercuts.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: GDS fares exceed direct rates 98% of the time, with an average premium of 1.23% in the latest week.
Spreads are higher for longer lead times at 99%, showing a 1.75% premium over the website.
